subject: Re: ServerTestCase
msgSnippet: Thanks to Pete McInstry s help, I was able to figure out that I had jndi.properties file on the cp that was referring to a JBOSS initial context factory.  I
messageBody:
Thanks to Pete McInstry's help, I was able to figure out that I had
jndi.properties file on the cp that was referring to a JBOSS initial
context factory. I changed it to Weblogic and got past this one.

However, now I'm getting the following:

javax.naming.CommunicationException [Root exception is
java.net.ConnectException: t3://localhost:7001: Destinati
on unreachable; nested exception is:
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect; No
available router to destination]

This is the exception that I got when using ant to compile and run the
junit test. I started running the test from a dos prompt calling
java, because that was how I got the ExampleServerTestCase to run.
But I eventually got back to this error (I guess because the other
code that I call is running outside the app server.)

How can I get around this?

Thanks.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "scohan2005" <scohan@g...> wrote:
> I am trying to integrate ServerTestCase with pre-existing junit
> tests. Right now, I'm just trying to test back end server DAO code -
> not ejbs. The back end code works - i'm just trying to get the tests
> converted to ServerTestCases. We've just moved to WebLogic 7.1.
>
> Within my test case, call it MyTestCase (that extends ServerTestCase
> ()), I have a main that instantiates MyTestCase passing
> in "MyTestCase". Before calling the method I want to test, I have to
> call a login class to set up some initial data that is required in my
> test method (i.e, login credential data). This login class connects
> to an oracle db to get the initial data. Before doing so, the login
> class attempts to instantiate an InitialContext (to get a
> connection), however, 'new InitialContext()' throws the following:
>
> javax.naming.NoInitialContextException: Cannot instantiate class:
> org.jnp.interfaces.NamingContextFactory [Root
> exception is java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
> org.jnp.interfaces.NamingContextFactory]
>
> The login code works when called from our Struts front end, but
> throws the above exception when called from MyTestCase. What am I
> missing as far as the InitialContext goes? It seems that
> ServerTestCase has successfully set up its InitialConext prior to me
> calling this other class. Shouldn't the Context then be available
> for subsequent InitialConext calls? Obviously, this is fuzzy to me.
>
> Thanks.
